*GRADUATION PROCEDURE*.

*Regulation No. 175 of the Rector of the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń dated September 25, 2023 on the procedure for conferring a degree at the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń at:* https://apd.umk.pl/.
(1) Before submitting an application for the initiation of the procedure for granting a professional degree, it is necessary to obtain credits in all subjects included in the study plan except for the seminar.
(2) The student shall submit the application for initiation of proceedings for conferring the degree electronically *in USOSweb > For students > applications > submit a new application*, *not later than 14 days before the scheduled date of the diploma exam*.
(3) In cases where the submission of a thesis is mandatory:

1. before entering the application, the student should obtain a statement from the promoter (Annex No. 2 to the above-mentioned Order), a scan of which *must* be attached to the application. *Without the attached statement, the application will be rejected.
(2) The title of the thesis in English shall be agreed by the student with the promoter. If the title needs to be verified, the student verifies the title in English with Ms. Renata Rychlicka (via email) and presents the verified title to the promoter so that he/she can already confirm the verification of the thesis title in English on the statement.

(1) After the application is approved by the Dean's Office and entered into USOS by the Dean's Office, the student submits the statements to the ADF and enters the thesis (see § 10 of the Ordinance in question).
(2) After the student enters the data in the ADF, the promoter checks the thesis in the JSA and approves it in the ADF (with the issuance of credit for the seminar and submission of statements).
(3) The promoter and the reviewer draft and approve the review in the ADF no later than 3 days before the date of the diploma exam.
4) *The electronic circulation card, which must be filled out in the USOS* system (tab for all > circulations), is ordered by the dean's office about a week before the scheduled defense date. You are required to answer questions about your contacts with the UMK Career Office. In addition, by the date of the defense, you must also settle accounts with the UMK Library and pay all financial obligations to UMK.
5 *Students may submit to the Dean's Office an additional application for a copy and diploma supplement in a foreign language* (possible languages for diploma copies: English, German, French, Spanish, Russian; diploma supplements with a list of grades in English only) :

*- free of charge until the date of defense:* you can apply for 1 copy of the diploma copy and 1 copy of the diploma supplement in one foreign language of your choice;

*- free of charge after the defense date:* you can apply for additional copies of the diploma and supplement in Polish;

*- paid after the defense date:* additional copies of the diploma and supplement in a foreign language may be applied for.

The defense schedule is sent to final year students via email from the dean's office.

*INFORMATION ON THE OBLIGATION OF SUBJECTS IN THE HUMANITIES OR SOCIAL SCIENCES*.

During your studies, each of you is required to complete subjects in the field of humanities or the field of social sciences as specified in the study program[1] (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl#_ftn1). This applies to both 1st degree and 2nd degree studies.

*Please familiarize yourself with the applicable program of study, in particular the obligation for subjects in the field of humanities or the field of social sciences.* Programs of study are available at http://www.mat.umk.pl/web/wmii/studia-stacjonarne-i-i-ii-stopnia1.

The way to fulfill this requirement is to choose appropriate subjects from the university-wide offer. You can find the current offerings at https://www.umk.pl/studenci/zajecia-ogolnouniwersyteckie/

From the offerings provided, you should select subjects from the humanities and social sciences.
